website_summaries.verdict: A hefty and fully-customizable PlayStation 4 controller that provides a wealth of options for hardcore PS4 and PC players.
pros: Features 4 remappable multifunction buttons, a companion app for fine-tuning, a hair-trigger mode for quick-firing, PC compatible, and connects via your choice of Bluetooth or wired mode
cons: A very expensive PS4 controller, but you’re paying for quality

customer_reviews.title: Nice controller that unusable due to stick drift out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Controller is nice but the drift out of the box makes it unusable. Left stick is particularly bad, always pulling to the right. Glitchy and inconsistent. This is with v1.1.0.0 firmware which came with the controller (so no current firmware update fix to try).
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: I am on my third Razer controller. ON EVERYONE ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third Razer controller. ON EVERYONE ONE OF THEM, the left thumb-stick eventually breaks and starts pulling in a direction. I love this controller when it's working, it's absolutely worthless once it starts to malfunction. It would seem they have very very poor quality parts.
customer_reviews.author: J Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Pictures
customer_reviews.text: The title and picture showed it is new Raiju TE edition, but when I placed the order, it changed to the old raiju and the picture does too. So this is not the New Raiju TE edition you are looking for. Stay away from this sale for now.
customer_reviews.author: Tianzhi Chu

customer_reviews.title: Stick drift breaks use of great controller.
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality. As for durability, I dont think this will survive a standing fall due to the type of controller it is. Im sure it can take a fall but I bet something will shift or come lose inside. Ease of use is good except the app might be an issue to those who dont know of it. Stick drift is ridiculous on it which is why I dont give it 5. Forums are full of complaints and no resolve yet. My left stick drifts up making it hard to hold angles on siege. BT has slight lag. Not game breaking but you notice it. Wierd to explain.
customer_reviews.author: Semiera

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, if it worked as advertised :(
customer_reviews.text: My Raiju TE began some slight stick drift within 30 days and became severe by 60 days old. After I contacted razer it took over 2 weeks to send a replacement out and when purchased from Amazon they will not refund it. While the controller was great while it worked for 30 days, the quality control and very poor customer service means I will not purchase anything else from Razer and cannot recommend it. Look for the new Nacon ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Worse Remote Ever Used!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware: Do not buy!!! Controller is not for FPS but more for racing games. No firmware installed - controller drifts, input lag, unergonomic and not for the advanced hardcore players playing more than 45 minutes. Waste of money and time. Comes with its own usb cord and must install on PC first for firmware. Paddles and Triggers are aweful. Will be replacing remote immediately and since I have used the remote I am prepared to be at loss.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Disappoint in this Product and Razer
customer_reviews.text: Upon using the controller for the first day there was nothing but excitement, until the next day when I noticed severe stick drift in the sticks. Not only that but the app does not properly pair with the device, also I noticed on the right stick that in some games it will slow turn to the right and fast turn to the left making playing shooters a nightmare. The controller also has unbearable input lag and frequent disconnects. I wanted to LOVE this controller but I just can't recommend it to anyone in its current state. I fully intend to return this ASAP. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GGgrinds

customer_reviews.title: This controller is sick
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a year before doing a review because Scuffs have broken on me in just a few months. Its been a year and its still in new condition. $110 and its far superior than a $200 scuff. if you're looking for a controller with paddles, get this. its amazing. i also have an xbox elite controller, which is known for being the best controller ever made, and i PREFER the razer to use on my PC. the only other controller I can recommend if you're in the market for one is the Nacon. That is also a solid controller. I have no regrets with the Razer
customer_reviews.author: KR4Q

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product it's really fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Used this controller for 5 months, and the left joystick sunk into the controller while I was holding it down trying to sprint in Fortnite. I do not recommend this controller because it's costs way more than it should, and plus, the default sensitivity of it is higher than a regular PS4 controller so the switch will take time if you're into shooters like Fortnite or COD which requires precise aim. I won't be trying to get it fixed because I'm tired of it, will be looking forward to purchasing a SCUF controller and see how much better it is since everyone is getting one. P.S. In the pics you can tell that the left joystick is off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel cmq

customer_reviews.title: Firmware issue is not fixed
customer_reviews.text: After being assured by so many users that firmware issues had been resolved with the proper update, I decided to buy this controller. Waiting to recurve a controller that I simply can’t use is extremely frustrating. I paid good money for a product that was pitched as a top of the line upgrade all to be duped because the thumb stick moves to the right on its own. Making the controller not usable. I’m so irate that instead of being able to enjoy myself and unwind while playing a game, I have to realize I’ve been ripped off and go through the tedious process of getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY, SEVERE DRIFT ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first pro controller, because I’ve had many razer products before and I’ve liked all of them. However this controller has been THE biggest waste of money, I’ve had it for just barely over a month and it has severe analog stick issues, which razer claims can be fixed with an update but it absolutely doesn’t work. It’s a solid feeling controller and I do like it, but the stick drift makes it UNUSABLE. Waste of money as of now until they make a better version of it. No pro controller should have issues as simple as drifting.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but seal was opened
customer_reviews.text: Item was stated new meanwhile seal was broken. The control seems to be fully functional with 1.5 update. Have no issues with drifting or disconnects after using it for a straight 1-2 hours via blue tooth Updating is extremely easy, just google raizer raiju tournament edition firmware update Plug the control into a free USB port on your computer or laptop after you download and open the file they provide. Switch controller to usb mode , then 1 minute later it’s done.
customer_reviews.author: Fashion Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great Pro Controller with out the High Price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this controller! Has a app that you can customize the buttons through. Love the 2 paddles. Only thing is that it would disconnect and you will have to have a dual-shock controller to work the PlayStation if the Razer is disconnected. You will need the dual shock to work the PlayStation in order to re connect the controller. Overall great pro controller for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Stark

customer_reviews.title: The controller is a piece of garbage with sub-standard components
customer_reviews.text: The controllers essential buttons (L3) for sprinting in a day and age of mechanical switches are trash and wear out in just a few months from mderate play. I was using mine in game and the spint became erractic and would continuously stop working and at certain instances wouldnt even more the character is the switch was activated. I can see why they don't sell this trash in the USA. Buy at your own risk just remember you were warned. Mine is now in the trash and I will never purchase another razor product again.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick V.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY THIS hunk of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I had a razer rajiu 1, great controller but I lost the back triggers and figured I would just upgrade to the new Tournament edition. Little did I know this controller is plagued with software issues, Bluetooth issues, and the joysticks are garbage and drift like no ones buisness. Don’t waste your money on the garbage controller. Also the company seems nice at first but in the end will screw you and not help u the minute it becomes an issue of the actual device
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty great besides the fact that the analogs break so ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty great besides the fact that the analogs break so easily. I play a lot of FPS games so analogs are pivotal and go through a lot of wear. I don’t even know how they break. It’s not the sellers fault at all and he’s worked with me on replacements via warranty in a smooth and orderly fashion 3 times already. However razer really needs to work on their components it causes trouble especially being that they have no bases within the US
customer_reviews.author: Archon

customer_reviews.title: Don't worry about the old photo...it's the new Raiju
customer_reviews.text: I saw a number of people canceling their orders because the product number and photo after ordering revert to the old Raiju. I can confirm that the new Tournament Edition Raiju arrived as expected. The seller appears to have simply updated the photos and text of the old Raiju product, so not all info was updated. Great controller. Having a good time with it—I prefer the asymmetrical sticks, so chose this over the Ultimate (I can control my stick height with KFs) Excellent build quality, nice buttons and sticks. No complaints so far—does wonders for gun control and building if you play that other game :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: I experienced an insane increase in mechanic ability the very first time plugging this bad boy in
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough positive. I experienced an insane increase in mechanic ability the very first time plugging this bad boy in. I tried both the Xbox One Afterglow, and four standard PS4 controllers before trying this out. I have fairly large hands (I can palm a basketball), which made the size of the Raiju a pleasant surprise in terms of comfort. The grip is great, the design is very ergonomic, the extra buttons are well placed. My only gripe? The driver they developed for PC compatibility is poor at best.
customer_reviews.author: AGW

customer_reviews.title: High Price + Button and Stick lag
customer_reviews.text: Great controller with excellent grip, but the only controller I've ever owned with input lag. I thought Razer was known for great products, but this is bad. I even installed the updated firmware and made sure the app was disabled onmy phone l AND I STILL GET LAG! I even use USB mode (inconvenient) to get better input. It's still horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Lexx

customer_reviews.title: but I like the extra buttons and their relocations
customer_reviews.text: It works well. Has a long cord. Didn't require any setup. The instructions to configure the buttons are VERY ambiguous. I haven't changed any button configurations, but I like the extra buttons and their relocations. It took a little time to get used to them but once you start using the controller, it gets easy. You can tell it's high quality. The cord is braided and it comes with a hard case as well. I wish Sony would come out with a comparable elite controller like Microsoft but until then, I'm stuck with 3rd party companies.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Bad headphones jacks
customer_reviews.text: So it doesn't say anywhere that this controller needs to be plugged in and wire a to the playstation for the headset to work even then the headset isn't working with the controller. Other than that its great, luckily I have a monitor with a head phone jack but if I didnt id be pissed. Its BS that the headsets don't work! Tournament controller? Don't they know headphones are an essential accessory for "Tournament Gaming?"
customer_reviews.author: shawnda mccorvey

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say my favorite controller has issues. I've purchased two of these rather expensive controllers and both have gone bad. Mostly the left control stick. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mikee

customer_reviews.title: Worth it?
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is nice, it's a little heavy for me sometimes I'll hit the extra buttons by accident just by holding the controller. Bluetooth is a hit and miss, sometimes it works just fine and others it will be a few seconds slow. I've heard it has something to do with the PS4 and not the controller, wish Razer had an Bluetooth dongle to plug in the PS4 just like alot of there competitors like Nacon. The cable is very high quality, wish it was a couple of feet longer IMO. Make sure to use an PC to change the button layout cause using Razer's mobile app is absolute S***.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Razer tournament horribkm
customer_reviews.text: I have the first razer raiju controller. Worked great for 13 months and counting. I decided I wanted the cordless version. I got it in and immediately felt noticeable button lag. Felt horrible. And the longer I played the worse the lag was. At one point there was a solid 2 seconds between pressing x and my character actually jumping. Same lag was present in the joysticks.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Edit.It's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Edit Amazon is sending a replacement Edit stopped working after a charge and now can not charge or connect in anyway I thoroughly like this controller the fact that I can customize the buttons while I'm in the middle of a game is nice so if the lay out I had isn't working I can do a quick re configuration and we are all set definitely worth the little extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris davis

customer_reviews.title: Mechsnical buttons, but not the dpad.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a ps4 controller with mechanical buttons. I should of specified a dpad with mechsnical buttons. I'm trying to adapt to this controller. It's rough. The app works. I always fat finger the extra back trigger buttons? Had to turn those off. The extra buttons on the back of the controller pop out a bit at the bottom. It's a fidget magnet during cutscenes that cant.be skipped. It isn't what I want nor will I use it myself, it's still a second controller. I'll have to research a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gates

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: At the price they're charging you should get three of these. Buttons are cheap, headphone output only works if it's directly wired in USB mode, right out of the box the left analog stick was going bad. Additional buttons on the back are hyper sensitive and pre-programmed to be intrusive, making an app download necessary, which also means giving away your personal information for them to sell to advertising. Also, the LED right under the touchpad is not adjustable, so you have a bright light shining in your eyes the entire time you're trying to play a video game. Moronic design.
customer_reviews.author: Klein B

customer_reviews.title: No Product Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Razer Raiju and in less than a year, it failed. The manufacturer has acknowledged that there is an issue with the controller but has refused to provide warranty support. They claim that Amazon and its third party sellers are not authorized re-sellers and will therefore not stand behind their warranty. The seller will not provide support either. I have purchased other controllers and mice by Razer and all have failed in less than 18 months. In the two cases where the item was still under warranty, Razer has refused to honor their warranty. I would highly recommend that you stay away from Razer products due to their lack of quality and support.
customer_reviews.author: J Condon

customer_reviews.title: Most satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The great thing about this controller it's is comfortable feel and response to any game you play and size, this really is a well designed controller but the only improvement it could have is it's dpad which could use some adjustments since it's not really a good use for fighting games but overall great
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Best PS4 pro controller available in the market
customer_reviews.text: Best pro controller available to PS4 up to date. Scuff controllers are a joke compared to this one. I had Scuff controllers before, they are good, but this Razor raizes the bar. Excellent for FPS games. Offers 2 profile configuration (for two types of playstyle).
customer_reviews.author: Renee Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Is not recognized as a ps4 controller on pc
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller I really do. Some things to note. I had to replace this controller once already due to bad stick drift. Sometimes the controller has HORRIBLE input lag both wired and wireless, even after updating the controller. To fix this I have to switch it from wired to wireless, which is easy,but annoying. Other than that, the controller feels great in my hand and has a wireless range of about 20 feet. Buttons feel good and the sticks have not worn out over 6 months like my scuf did. Would recommend but not at the price I bought it at. ($130, if you can get it for less, worth it.)
customer_reviews.author: Seth Nordman

customer_reviews.title: Gimmicks aren't always true.
customer_reviews.text: The controller makes my left index finger hurt because of me constantly pushing down the left analog and using my index finger to hold the controller. The thumbsticks are ps3 sized so my kontrol freeks didn't fit and it honestly didnt make me play better. I went back to the regular controller and added the vortex control freeks and instantly played better. The controller doesnt really make you play better. I'm just uaing the controller as a normal controller now to play sports games.
customer_reviews.author: Caz Wallace

customer_reviews.title: absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: RAZOR whats the deal? made by players for players?? Besides the fact the product on display is not the device you get this controller is junk!! DO NOT BUY THIS!! IT WILL NOT WORK PROPERLY.!! the blue tooth barely works, major latency unless using the cable. good luck pairing it and even more luck using the very useless mobile app. that is really bad and will not satay /reconnect to the controller. as well the motion sensitivity for the analog controls do not work at all. seriously Razor why is this on the market? i thought you knew how to make good gear!!!! but i guess that was in the past.
customer_reviews.author: pater

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: Received March 29th and it worked till April 6th. My R2 trigger refuses to work. Just randomly wouldn’t work while in mid game. (Cost me a death on Fortnite) The buttons PS button got sticky within the first week. The cord controller connection was spotty. If I bumped the cord a little it disconnected. I babied this controller. No spills, never touched with food covered hands, never dropped. Beautiful design though. Fits in my hands perfectly. It worked flawlessly for the first week. I must have ended up with a faulty controller. Would I buy again? Yes. I’d give it another chance. Hopefully they will do something about my bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: pure scam.
customer_reviews.text: after 15 days of use playing fifa 18 the left command when I lower it and without releasing it moving it up does not raise the player. I thought it was a game problem. then place the original ps4 control and it works perfectly. This control is a garbage and Amazon has to take it out of their sale. do not spend 150 on this garbage is a scam and Amazon is an accomplice of it.
customer_reviews.author: Yamil Saab

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck considering all of the other options on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for about 2 months now and I’m very happy with the product. It’s Razer, so you can expect quality. Pros: Solid build. Especially if you like the Xbox one controller style, but prefer the PS4 layout. Has hair trigger locks for shooters and such. Has four additional mappable buttons, two triggers on the underside(both removable) and two additional buttons beside your R1 and L1. Includes a 10ft. long braided cable. Includes removable thumb tabs for the sticks. Con: Just one. It isn’t wireless. Take that into consideration if you have little ones around or a cable would be a trip hazard. The cable, again, is 10ft. long which gives you plenty of length.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good design, poor quality parts used.
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I liked was the size, the controller fit well in my hands, but that’s where it stops Poor quality. Buttons were loose and rattled. Vibration was on for every little thing that happened, even just one little step forward (vibration never stoped, very annoying). Short throw buttons didn’t work for half the games I played. Click L3 to sprint and character wouldn’t keep sprinting unless I put enough pressure on the stick to feel like it’s about to break (thumb didn’t like that). Overly sensitive controls, had to change the look and move sensitivity constantly as game play changed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Way

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited when this arrived and then extremely disappointed when I realized I Purchased $150 dead product. It didn’t work out of the box and I see others sold here don’t work either. I hope it wasn’t repackage. It felt really good to hold but never powered on. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Faulty controller
customer_reviews.text: The handling of the controller was great. It had style and felt real and not too plastic-ey.. like other controllers, however, I returned this controller due to the bluetooth function not working correctly. The controller would connect to my console via bluetooth and then suddenly freeze and disconnect after about 2 seconds. Overall, I had to return the control because that's not something you can simply be okay with. Other than receiving a faulty controller, it was alright. Just a little disappointed because the controller costs $100 which is... A LOT compared to other controllers and then to receive a faulty one is just disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Terrible controller for a premium price
customer_reviews.text: This controller is an expensive mess. It lags in wireless and wired mode. The triggers stopped working after a firmware update. I reset the controller and now the triggers activate by the slightest vibration of the controller. The dpad is sunken in, making diagonal inputs even more difficult and eventually the dpad started responding reluctantly and requiring more and more force to input directions. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Better than my SCUF controller
customer_reviews.text: Well built, doesn’t feel cheap. Very comfortable if you’re used to the XBOX controller layout. If you’re not, it won’t take long to get used to the layout. Hair trigger mode kicks ass and through the app you can set up different profiles depending on the game you’re playing. I own two SCUF controllers and for the price I payed I feel the Razer has a better build quality than both. I’ve been playing with it for about a month now without any issues period. I have profiles currently set for BO4 & RDR2 and they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Savinon

customer_reviews.title: Razer Raiju TE - Solid Build, but unusable
customer_reviews.text: I own the original Razer Raiju controller, and it works flawlessly. Naturally, when the Razer Raiju TE released I wanted to upgrade to the wireless option and offset stick layout. The build quality is amazing, and the controller is super comfortable in the hand. However, even with the firmware update razer put out to fix it, the controller suffers from stick drift that makes it unusable. Using it to play shooters like Black Ops 4 or Fortnite puts you at a tremendous disadvantage.
customer_reviews.author: knytimez

customer_reviews.title: Usually Razer is amazing....not this time.
customer_reviews.text: I love Razer products!!! I own a few of their other products and they are top notch. This controller however was not good. It kept disconnecting from my ps4 and didn’t seem to hold my programming. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Harper

customer_reviews.title: I love the way the buttons feel and remapping the extra ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this controller for about a month now. I love the way the buttons feel and remapping the extra ones is very easy. I also like the added features in the bottom of the controller that allow you to control the headset volume and mic mute. The thing I like least about it is the d-pad and how stiff the buttons are there.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: NO WARRANTY SUPPORT!
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift, it worked well at first but then the left analog stick began malfunctioning. This led me to jump through hoops with razer support for about a week and a dozen emails and chats, all for nothing. Razer stated they do not actually sell the razer raiju in the US, even thought their official amazon page has it for sale and they can do nothing to fix a defective product they sell. Extremely frustrating experience considering the cost of the controller and bare minimum expectations of a 1 yr warranty Do not buy this product, razer doesn’t stand by it and if anything goes wrong you're SOL
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: App is virtually useless for button mapping. Joystick sensitivity will randomly spike/change when in bluetooth mode. Not a good controller at all for the price. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Best PS4 controller ever
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best PS4 controller I’ve ever used. I wanted a controller that feels comfortable in my hands and the Duelshock 4 controllers aren’t comfortable for me. I couldn’t get used to the layout of the controller when it comes to the sticks and the dpad. But thanks to the Razer raiju tournament edition it’s solved my problem. Plus it’s got extra buttons to up my game which is a big plus. It is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Honestly A VERY GOOD controller.
customer_reviews.text: The controller might look bigger but when i recieved this product, it felt so comfortable to hold. The buttons are really satisfying to press and instant feedback from the mechanical feeling. Everything is great about this control. I play all kinds of games (rocket league, fifa, cod, need for speed) and all games feel great with this controller. I highly recommend for the price as this is well built.
customer_reviews.author: jonny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gaming controller
customer_reviews.text: It's lovely, it gives alot more advantage compared to a regular PS4 controller. It feels great and very comfortable but it does take time to get used to since it's more of an xbox form. Sounds of clicking are very satisfying and I usually dislike having a wired controller but with the long braided cord it feels nice
customer_reviews.author: Chan T

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This controller has me drooling! I have the best top notch gaming controller in my hand! This reassuring clicks of the buttons like a gaming mouse and smooth anolog sticks give me the edge in every single fire fight! If you need to step up your skill this take it from 7/10 to a 11/10. You’ll be sorry to not get this!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Marqua

customer_reviews.title: 4 months in and it drifts...
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this controller with Christmas money and money he earned...loves it...the programmable features are great...BUT...after 4 months, the left joystick drifts. That is horrible for gameplay and dealing with menu settings. Working with Razer, we updated the firmware and reset which helped a little...they referred me back to Amazon for a replacement...we’ll see what Amazon does but Razer said to connect back w them if Amazon doesn’t help
customer_reviews.author: dif family vlog

customer_reviews.title: Great controller but......
customer_reviews.text: Great controller for the price, its very responsive buttons are very clicky and easy to press has some stick drift but with a little calibration it goes away the only problem I have is it won't connect to the one game I play the most "Frotnite" don't know why but that's a big problem razor having a product That doesn't connect easily to the most popular game out there. Just for this thinking about returning or giving it to a friend that has PlayStation even though I'm a razor fan boy.
customer_reviews.author: ruben r.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The controller had bad stick drift after 5 minutes of game play. Multiple buttons would activate after pressing r2. For the price, I was disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this isn't a bad controller, however the disappointment comes in features you're paying extra for. This review is as compared to a standard PS4 controller. Pros: Durability, button click (mouse type), Razer customer service Cons: Hair trigger doesn't activate consistently causing you to lose gunfights, offset directional joystick (Xbox style) is uncomfortable & causes pain during long gaming sessions, joystick sensitivity control is so marginal as to not be a noticeable difference. Overall I would not recommend nor will I buy again. I'm out of the return window but would send back if I could.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: E sports games? But I play only FPS......
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome controller, very solid built, the grip is excellent, and good weight for long gaming sessions, im playing BF1-BF4-and Rainbow six siege,with no issues, as u can see I'm not playing e sports games, and yes is pricey ,it could be a little cheaper!This controller is gonna be even better, with the new upcoming battlefield-Player unknown Battlegrounds-H1Z1,for the rrason that these games require a lot of buttons and the Razer has 4 extra and a huge ability to maped with the way you want I liked so far for long game playing with my PS4 PRO, very responsive R1,L1,R2,L2 buttons!!!I will update if I notice something huge negative happens!
customer_reviews.author: JOHNNY

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and Cheap Feeling
customer_reviews.text: This controller has some things going for it like the app to remap, mechanical buttons, pc compatibility and Bluetooth or wired but... Compared to something like the Xbox elite it feels cheap. It took me 20 mins to pair with my ps4 and then it was super laggy. I’d look at a Scuf for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, awful software
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a very well built piece of work. Buttons feel nice and responsive. Build quality is extremely good. I don't see it breaking anytime soon. The software is the problem. Incompatibility with common headsets, digital stick drifts and a really harsh deadzone make this a hard sell. You have to put way too much effort recalibrating the controller and updating it's drivers to get the full experience. If they managed to fix this, I would recommend this to anyone, not just pro players. Also the D-Pad is awful for fighting games such as SFV, Skullgirls, and FighterZ, so if you're an FGC guy look elsewhere

product_meta.title: Razer Raiju Tournament Edition Without the1.04 Firmware Gaming Controller Bluetooth & Wired Connection (PS4 PC USB Controller with Four Programmable Buttons, Ergonomics Optimized for Esports)
product_meta.description:
Quick-firing frenzy When it comes to console gaming, your controller is the most crucial weapon in your arsenal. Milliseconds make all the difference when you’re in the heat of battle. When Hair Trigger Mode is activated, the mechanical stop-switches greatly reduce travel distance to the two main triggers, enabling quick-firing action to deliver the competitive edge. 

Every component of the Razer Raiju for PlayStation 4 has been optimised to give you every possible competitive advantage - from four additional fully-programmable buttons, to the weight and shape of the controller and even a quick control panel. 

Made from high durable materials and extensively tested by esports athletes, dominate your game with this unrivalled controller. 

At a glance 
Works with PS4 and PC (Windows® 7 and above) Bluetooth/Wired connection Mobile app for easy configuration Ergonomic multi-function button layout 

Box Contains: 
1 x Razer Raiju Gaming Controller 
1 x Carrying Case 
1 x USB to Micro-USB cable 
1 x Important Product Information Guide
feature_bullets: The Razer Raiju Tournament Edition is the first Bluetooth and wired controller to have a mobile configuration app, enabling control from remapping multi-function buttons to adjusting sensitivity clutch options. Switch between 3 connectivity modes: PS4, USB and PC without manual re-pairing for optimal efficiency.

Mecha-Tactile Action Buttons provide a soft cushioned touch with crisp tactile feedback. The Raiju Tournament Edition also delivers total control with 4 remappable multi-function buttons and Hair Trigger Mode for quick-firing action. Enjoy ultimate control at your fingertips as you master next-level techniques.

Esay app control.Remap multi-function buttons and triggers, adjust sensitivity clutch options or fine-tune the intensity of rumble motors to complete your in-game experience—all with easy mobile app control.

Bluetooth&wired connection.The Raiju Tournament Edition is our first controller to feature both Bluetooth and wired connection. Enjoy total freedom gaming wirelessly whether at home or at your best mates’, and simply switch to wired gameplay during a tournament for that extra assurance. The choice is yours.
